title: Development Victoria calls on developers to help renew Wodonga
excerpt: Wodonga's Junction Place project is moving into its next phase, with Development Victoria calling for expressions of interest to develop five key sites. Almost 50,000 sqm of land is up for transformation into mixed-use precincts, with interested parties able to bid for all or just some of the sites.
imageAlt: Development Victoria calls on developers to help renew Wodonga
author: Building Environs

sections.alt: Development Victoria calls on developers to help renew Wodonga
sections.caption: Image credit: Development Victoria

sections.content: [Wodonga's Junction Place project](https://www.development.vic.gov.au/projects/junction-place-wodonga?page=overview) is moving into its next phase, with Development Victoria calling for expressions of interest to develop five key sites.
Almost 50,000 sqm of land is up for transformation into mixed-use precincts, with interested parties able to bid for all or just some of the sites. The EOI process ends on 21 August.
Development Victoria's Group Head Precincts, Niall Cunningham, highlighted the opportunity Junction Place brings to builders and developers.
'We are seeking developers passionate about making a positive impact in Wodonga, one of regional Victoria's fastest-growing cities.

'The next stage is an opportunity to build on the good work already done to revitalise the heart of central Wodonga and we want developers to come forward with their best proposals to enhance the precinct further.'
Junction Place is Australia's largest regional urban renewal initiative. At completion, it will double the size of Wodonga's CBD.
It will bring a wealth of new facilities to the regional town, including hospitality venues, retail, health and medical facilities, and entertainment hot spots.
Development Victoria is delivering the project in partnership with the City of Wodonga.

**Are you looking for construction staff?**

**Building Environs is a Melbourne-based recruitment agency for Construction, Engineering & Property.** [Browse available candidates now](https://www.buildingenvirons.com.au/available-candidates/).
